item.title: Azure DevOps pipeline stuck on 'Initialize job' Step-by-step fix
item.description:
Azure DevOps pipeline stuck on ‘Initialize job’? Step-by-step fix

Ever had your Azure DevOps pipeline hang at the very first step – Initialize job – and not move forward?

This issue is frustrating and common — especially with self-hosted agents, permissions misconfiguration, or pipeline resource locks.

Let’s break down exactly how to troubleshoot and fix this problem step-by-step.

What does ‘Initialize job’ actually mean?

It’s the very first phase in a pipeline run:

item.title: Azure DevOps Git Repos Not Showing in Build Pipeline: Fixing Broken Repo Connections
item.description:
Seeing this error when trying to trigger a pipeline from your Azure DevOps repo?

Error: The repository ‘’ could not be found or no longer exists.

Common Causes

  • Repository renamed or deleted
  • Permissions changed in the project
  • PAT token expired (for GitHub or external repos)

Fixing the Issue

Azure Repos Git

  • Navigate to Repos in your project
  • Check if the repo still exists and hasn’t been renamed
  • Confirm the branch in your trigger matches the YAML
trigger:
 branches:
 include:
 - main

GitHub Repositories

Go to Project Settings → Service Connections Open your GitHub connection Re-authenticate or update the PAT/token Ensure scopes: repo, workflow, admin:repo_hook
